zone.line: Is like poor Margaret —
Mephist.
Let it be - pass on —
No good can come of it - it is not well
To meet it - it is an enchanted phantom
A lifeless Idol, with its' numbing look
It freezes up the blood of man, & they
Who meet its ghastly stare are turned
to stone
Like those who saw Medusa -
Faust
O too true!
Her eyes are like the eyes of a fresh corpse
Which no beloved hand has closed, alas
That is the breast which Margaret
yielded to me
Those are the lovely limbs which I enjoyed.
Mephist.
It is all magic poor deluded fool
She looks to every one like his first love.
Faust turn
O what delight! what woe! I cannot
nance
My looks from her sweet piteous counte
